New Records: Georges Mikautadze is the only player at Euro 2024 to score three times in the group stage.
Georges Mikautadze has gone out on his own in the race for the Golden Boot.
Georges Mikautadze has scored in all of his side's group-stage games, joining an exclusive list of eight players to have done that previously.
Key Match Events: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia scored a goal after just 93 seconds to set Georgia on the path to their famous victory.
Georges Mikautadze converted a penalty to score his third goal at Euro 2024.
Georgia had just 28 per cent possession against Portugal, the lowest by a winning team at the European Championship on record.
Mamardashvili made a key save to keep out a Felix cross towards Semedo at the far post.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts consider Spain the strongest team we have seen so far, and Portugal will be very confident of making it into the quarter-final against them.
Post-Match Reflections: Georgia have secured their knockout place as the second best of the third-placed teams.
Portugal had already sewn up top spot in Group F and a late winner for Turkey against 10-man Czech Republic has sent them through to the last 16 as runners up.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the biggest upset in European Championship history on world rankings.
Georgia will play in the last 16 against Spain.
Others: Georgia's 2-0 win against Portugal is a fitting ending to this group stage â€” the underdogs have, by and large, been competitive and made for some fantastic matches.
Georgia's performance has been fully deserved, with their defence and midfield outgunning a far superior Portugal midfield.
